BLOG

Deep—and sometimes difficult—thoughts.

The Process of Fields

Less than fifteen minutes now. I have a fear of writing in public places, as if someone might see or read over my shoulder and have a bunch of opinions. Isn’t that weird? Isn’t it weird that I’m afraid of other people’s opinions? I mean, really, what sense does that make?

Even the Smallest Beliefs

Beliefs are everywhere. They’re in everything we do, from how we style our hair to how we go to sleep at night. They’re in the car we drive and the home we live in. They’re in how we approach a new problem and how we respond to crisis.

MORE >

The Act of Reconstruction

It has been quite the year. I think I might still be absorbing it all. This has been a year of massive growth, as well as massive upset, from macrocosm to microcosm.
